item.title: Little Caesars Casino: A Forgotten Gem of Vintage Las Vegas Strip History
item.description:
The Oddball on the Strip: Introducing Little Caesars Casino

The Las Vegas Strip of today is synonymous with sprawling resorts, opulent decor, and high-roller experiences. But rewind to the 1970s and 80s, and the landscape was vastly different. Nestled between the burgeoning MGM Grand (later Bally’s) and the glittering promises of the future, sat a truly unique and almost unbelievable establishment: Little Caesars Casino. No, not that Little Caesars – the pizza chain. This was a standalone, compact sportsbook-casino hybrid operating from roughly 1970 until its closure in 1994, located at 3665 South Las Vegas Boulevard. It’s a place largely forgotten now, but its story perfectly encapsulates a pivotal era in Las Vegas’s gambling evolution.
